intro: Hieracium pronum, commonly known as the lesser spear-thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are spiny and have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium pronum is often found in temperate regions and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
